name: apr
description: Core Apache Portable Runtime (APR) libraries, providing cross-platform abstractions for networking, filesystem, and threading.
usage: Dependency for Apache HTTP Server and other apps
features: Memory Management: Pool-based allocation
Threading: Portable mutexes and condition variables
File I/O: Atomic operations, mmap support
Shared Memory: Cross-platform IPC
additional_resources: APR API documentation

name: apt-file
description: A utility to search for files in Debian packages, ideal for finding missing dependencies or package contents.
usage: Search packages: apt-file search libssl.so
features: Remote Searches: Query repository contents
Cache Management: Update with apt-file update
Regex Support: Advanced pattern matching
Multi-Arch: Handles foreign architectures
additional_resources: Debian Wiki and man pages

name: apt-ftparchive
description: A tool to generate APT repository metadata, used for creating custom package archives or mirrors.
usage: Generate Packages.gz: apt-ftparchive packages . > Packages
features: Metadata Generation: Creates Packages, Release files
GPG Signing: Integrates with GPG for secure repos
Compression: Supports gzip, xz, and bzip2
Filtering: Include/exclude packages by criteria
additional_resources: Debian Administrator's Handbook

name: apt-transport-tor
description: An APT transport method for downloading packages over the Tor anonymity network. Enhances privacy for Debian-based systems.
usage: Configure sources.list with tor+http:// URLs
features: Tor Integration: Routes traffic through Tor nodes
Onion Services: Supports .onion repositories
Transparent Proxy: No manual SOCKS configuration
Fallback: Auto-fallback to clearnet if Tor fails
additional_resources: Whonix documentation

name: apt
description: Advanced Package Tool (APT) for managing Debian packages. Handles installation, removal, and dependency resolution.
usage: Install packages: apt install nginx
features: Dependency Resolution: Automatic handling of package relationships
Sources Management: /etc/apt/sources.list configuration
Version Pinning: Hold packages at specific versions
Secure APT: GPG signature verification
additional_resources: APT User's Guide

name: aptly
description: A powerful Debian repository management tool designed for mirroring, snapshotting, and publishing APT repositories. Enables reproducible repository states and complex workflow automation for package maintainers.
usage: Create repository snapshots: aptly snapshot create stable-2024 from mirror bookworm-main
features: Mirror Management: Clone remote repositories with GPG verification
Snapshot Isolation: Freeze repository states for testing/rollbacks
Publishing: Serve repos via HTTP/HTTPS or S3-compatible storage
Dependency Resolution: Handle complex package relationships
REST API: Integrate with CI/CD pipelines via HTTP endpoints
additional_resources: Official documentation includes migration guides and API references

community_and_support.forums: GitHub Discussions and Debian Packaging mailing lists

name: argon2-static
description: Statically linked version of Argon2, the winner of the 2015 Password Hashing Competition. Provides memory-hard hashing for secure password storage and key derivation.
usage: Compile into applications: gcc -largon2 -static myapp.c
features: Memory-Hard Computation: Resistant to GPU/ASIC attacks
Thread Support: Parallel hashing for performance
RFC 9106 Compliance: Implements Argon2id variant
Side-Channel Resistance: Protected against timing attacks
additional_resources: PHC documentation and cryptanalysis papers

name: argon2
description: Dynamic library implementation of Argon2 password hashing algorithm. Essential for modern authentication systems requiring secure credential storage.
usage: Hash passwords via CLI: argon2 somesalt -t 3 -m 12 -p 1
features: Adaptive Cost Parameters: Adjust memory/time/threads
CLI Utility: Direct password hashing from terminal
Cross-Platform: Works with Linux/Unix systems
Language Bindings: Python/Node.js/Rust integrations
additional_resources: OWASP Password Storage Cheat Sheet

name: argp-static
description: Static GNU argp library for parsing command-line arguments with --help/--version support. Provides POSIX-compliant argument handling for C applications.
usage: Link in C projects: gcc -largp -static myapp.c
features: Hierarchical Help: Nested argument documentation
Error Handling: Built-in error message formatting
Portability: Emulates glibc argp on non-GNU systems
Custom Parsers: Extend with custom option filters
additional_resources: GNU C Library documentation

name: argp
description: Dynamic GNU argp library for advanced command-line argument parsing. Enables rich CLI interfaces with automatic help generation and option grouping.
usage: Runtime dependency for argp-enabled applications
features: Automatic --help: Generates formatted documentation
Option Aliases: Short/long option variants
Version Reporting: Standard --version output
POSIX Compliance: Follows getopt_long conventions
additional_resources: Linux man-pages project

name: aria2
description: A lightweight multi-protocol download utility supporting HTTP/HTTPS, FTP, SFTP, BitTorrent, and Metalink. Designed for high-speed parallel downloads and remote control via JSON-RPC.
usage: Download with 16 connections: aria2c -x16 https://example.com/large.iso
features: Multi-Source: Combine HTTP and torrent sources
Resume Capability: Continue interrupted downloads
RPC Interface: Control via XML-RPC/JSON-RPC
Metalink Support: Automatic mirror selection
Cookies/Auth: Handle login-protected resources
additional_resources: Official man pages and cookbook

name: arj
description: A legacy archiving utility compatible with ARJ format popular in DOS-era systems. Maintains support for multi-volume archives and file versioning.
usage: Extract ARJ archive: arj x archive.arj
features: Volume Splitting: Span archives across floppies/disks
File Recovery: Rebuild damaged archives
Password Protection: AES-256 encryption
DOS Compatibility: Preserve 8.3 filenames
additional_resources: ARJ Software Inc. technical documentation

name: arpack-ng
description: A collection of Fortran77 subroutines for solving large-scale eigenvalue problems. Core dependency for scientific computing in Python (SciPy) and R.
usage: Link in numerical applications: gfortran -larpack myeigen.f
features: Arnoldi Method: For non-symmetric matrices
Parallel Support: MPI-based distributed computing
Single/Double Precision: Float/double implementations
Reverse Communication: Flexible matrix operations
additional_resources: User guide and BLAS/LAPACK integration docs

name: artalk
description: A self-hosted comment system prioritizing privacy and simplicity. Offers Markdown support, anti-spam measures, and seamless integration with static site generators.
usage: Run server: artalk server -c artalk.yml
features: Privacy-First: No tracking or external services
Moderation Tools: Akismet integration
SSO Support: OAuth2/OpenID Connect
Email Notifications: Reply tracking
Import/Export: Disqus/WordPress migration

usage: Run script: arturo hello.art
features: REPL Environment: Interactive coding sessions
FFI Support: Call C libraries directly
Concurrency: Async/await and actors model
Batteries Included: Built-in JSON/YAML/XML parsers
Cross-Compile: Generate standalone binaries

name: asciidoc
description: A mature text document format and toolchain for writing books, articles, and documentation with semantic markup. Generates HTML, PDF, EPUB, and man pages.
usage: Convert to HTML: asciidoc -b html5 document.txt
features: Semantic Markup: Abstracts presentation from content
Extensions: Custom filters and XSLT stylesheets
Math Support: LaTeX equations via MathJax
Table of Contents: Auto-generated navigation
PDF Output: Via DocBook toolchain

name: asciidoctor
description: A modern implementation of AsciiDoc in Ruby, featuring faster processing, enhanced syntax, and direct integration with static site generators like Jekyll.

features: HTML5 Backend: Semantic output with CSS theming

name: asm-lsp
description: A Language Server Protocol (LSP) implementation for assembly languages (x86, ARM, and RISC-V), providing real-time syntax checking, code completion, and disassembly features. Integrates with editors like VSCode, Vim, and Emacs for modern assembly development workflows.
usage: Configure your editor's LSP client to point to asm-lsp for assembly file support.
features: Multi-Architecture: Supports x86-64, ARM32/64, and RISC-V syntax
Semantic Highlighting: Distinguishes registers, mnemonics, and literals
Disassembly Preview: Inline machine code visualization
Error Diagnostics: Detects invalid opcodes and addressing modes

name: aspell-de
description: German dictionary package for GNU Aspell, enabling spell-checking for German-language texts with support for compound words, umlauts, and regional variants (e.g., Swiss German).
usage: Check German text: aspell -d de check document.txt
features: Compound Word Handling: Properly validates words like 'Arbeitsunfähigkeitsbescheinigung'
Umlaut Support: Recognizes ä, ö, ü, and ß
Regional Variants: Includes Austrian and Swiss German rules
Custom Wordlists: Add technical/domain-specific terms
additional_resources: Aspell manual and Debian localization guides

name: aspell-en
description: Comprehensive English dictionary for GNU Aspell, covering American, British, Canadian, and Australian English variants with scientific, technical, and literary vocabulary.
usage: Spell-check English documents: aspell -d en check thesis.tex
features: Variant Support: -ise/-ize suffixes, colour/color distinctions
Scientific Vocabulary: Includes terms from biology, physics, and mathematics
Profanity Filter: Optionally flag informal/inappropriate words
Update Mechanism: Regular additions from Wiktionary
additional_resources: Aspell customization guide for domain-specific vocabularies

name: aspell-es
description: Spanish dictionary for GNU Aspell with support for Castilian, Latin American, and regional dialects. Includes accented characters (ñ, á, é) and verb conjugations.
usage: Verify Spanish text: aspell -d es check documento.txt
features: Diacritic Handling: Properly validates accents and tildes

name: aspell-fr
description: French language dictionary for GNU Aspell, including modern orthography, Canadian French variants, and classical literary terms. Supports ligatures (œ, æ) and elisions.
usage: Check French text: aspell -d fr check rapport.txt

name: axel
description: Axel is a command-line download accelerator that speeds up file downloads by using multiple connections for one file.
usage: After installing, use axel to download files faster by opening multiple connections.
features: Download Acceleration: Speed up file downloads with multiple connections.
Command-Line Tool: Use axel from the command line for efficient downloads.
Cross-Platform: Works on multiple operating systems including Windows, Linux, and macOS.
additional_resources: For more information, visit the Axel documentation and community forums.

community_and_support.forums: Check out forums dedicated to download tools for support and discussions.
community_and_support.GitHub: Visit the Axel GitHub repository for source code, issues, and contributions.
